channel.title: Validasi Data dan Penjaminan Kualitas on HOT-PDC Training Site
channel.description: Recent content in Validasi Data dan Penjaminan Kualitas on HOT-PDC Training Site

item.title: Quality Assurance Concept
item.description: Learning Objectives: Understanding the definition of quality assurance Understanding the meaning of data quality assurance in OpenStreetMap OpenStreetMap (OSM) is a free and open source map. OSM has a lot of data and information about various types of objects that exist on the surface of the earth. The data is collected and entered by OSM users spread all over the world. The variety of data entered and collected by OSM users often results in the quality of the data being different from one another and the lack of understanding of OSM users regarding data quality also affects the results of data available in OSM.

item.title: JOSM for Data Quality
item.description: Objectives: Understanding how to select and count numbers of objects in certain administration boundary Understanding how to count numbers of error and warning in certain administration boundary Understanding how to validate administration boundary One of the expected results in doing mapping activity is to produce a good quality map. The quality including object information completeness and right topology. Using OpenStreetMap as a base map to show the result of field survey could help you to monitor the progress of your mapping activity result by counting objects and information from the field.
